prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: we are looking for lines with few detections in the literature and we do not know exactly what to expect, so a relatively fine sampling is necessary.
we are looking at barely resolved objects very close to each other.
we expect a weak line, with a peak of a few mJy. 3 mJy peaks would be detected at 5 sigma.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: the [CII] 157.74 micron fine structure line has proven to be a valuable tracer for the interstellar medium at high redshift. In previous studies, this line has been found up to redshift z~7, but most of the galaxies where it has been detected are somewhat extreme, with very high star formation rates, not representative of the galaxy population. More modest star forming galaxies have failed to show significant [CII] emission at z~6, with the exception of a few merging/interacting objects. we propose to observe 4 spectroscopically confirmed (6.3<z<6.5) and 2 non spectroscopically confirmed (z~7.5) merging galaxies with low star formation rates to test the hypothesis that environment can influence [CII] emission.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
